reviews.review_msg: He's an okay lecturer. Reads off his papers while lecturing tho :/ Overall the class isn't bad, just a lot of memorization and make sure you watch all the films since the exams require you to be able to analyze different images from films

Clear, articulate and enthusiastic about course matter. Only 3 assignments and only the final paper required a significant effort/time investment. You may find some of his selections to be challenging or difficult to watch. Remember you are here to be challenged, not entertained.

Don't buy the textbook; there's no final exam for the course. Don't expect to see 'great' films in this class. Blair's approachable and intelligent but I'm very upset about him showing Crash (1996) right after course evaluations. It's practically****; if you don't believe me, look it up. It has a rating worse than R and should never be shown.
